2. Ambiguity in node naming: If the nodes are not uniquely identified or if there are multiple nodes with the same name 'od', it could be challenging to determine which path to take.

3. Depth or breadth of the tree: A very deep or wide tree could make it time-consuming to manually trace the path to the target node.

4. Incomplete or incorrect tree data: If the tree file is missing information or contains errors, it may not be possible to accurately determine the path.

6. Unspecified root node: If the root node is not clearly identified, it might be difficult to know where to start tracing the path.
